model_answer: The answer is A: Event 11’s Peanuts montage of seasonal classics with excited kid voices and lines like “I believe in the Great Pumpkin!” and “There is an Easter Beagle!” highlighting many titles on DVD/video. This scene sets up the theme of the importance of Peanuts in pop culture and creates excitement for the upcoming release of the DVD and video titles. It also provides a glimpse into the fun and memorable moments that make Peanuts such a beloved franchise. The other events may build anticipation or promote specific titles, but they do not directly set up the final Peanuts call-to-action as effectively as the seasonal classics montage.

The answer is A, B, C. All three events directly build up to the consolidated Oswald rollout in event 8. 

Event 5 announces Oswald's debut on home video and DVD, showing the Oswald titles and stage visuals, which creates anticipation for his upcoming appearances. The VHS lineup and Oswald's enthusiastic line also contribute to building excitement.

Event 6 introduces "Outdoors with Oswald," showcasing his adventures and making him a household name. This event helps to establish Oswald's popularity and further builds anticipation for his future projects.

Event 7 provides a narrated introduction to the "Welcome to Big City" DVD, featuring Oswald and his friends. This event also helps to solidify Oswald's position as a beloved character and reinforces the idea that he will be part of a larger media franchise.

Event 3's Dora the Explorer teaser does not build up to the Oswald rollout in event 8, as it is focused on a different character and product.
